title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture       Learn more about the history of the Pacific War by exploring these pages. Hear the stories of people who lived through the Pearl Harbor attack - both service members and civilians - and find out more about each attack site on Oahu, as well as throughout the Pacific.              People   Learn about the service members and civilians who died on Dec 7, 1941. Here the stories of those who lived through the attack.         Places    Learn about all the key military sites on Oah'u, Hawai'i, as well as the sites of major battles in the Pacific.                      Stories   Read survivor stories and learn about what happened on December 7, 1941.        Preservation   The Monument relies on citizens like you donating family heirlooms, memorabilia, photographs, and diaries to tell the Pacific War story.
